page.title: 11CHORLTON GREEN
page.content: Chorlton Green, which was once the centre of the original village, is a conservation area dating from 1970, being designated under the Civic Amenities Act of 1967. South of the Green is St. Clement's churchyard, containing the site of the first parish church dating from the early 16th century. It was replaced by the second church in 1780, and closed in 1940. The bell tower was donated as a Jubilee gift in 1888 and is now Grade 2 listed. Two houses on the west side of the Green were once farmhouses and are also Grade 2 listed.
